org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the Matter of the Application of Alfonso Gagliardi for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
To the Honorable Jeremiah Neterer, Judge of the District Court of the United States, for the Western District of Washington.

Now comes the respondent, T.W.LYNCH, Acting United States Commissioner of Immigration for the District of Washington with headquarters at the port of Seattle, Washington, and for answer and return to the said order to show cause issued herein requiring said respondent to show cause why the writ of habeas corpus should not be granted herein, says that he here produces the body of ALFONSO GAGLIARDI, the person named in the petition for said writ, in obedience to the command and direction of said order to show cause; and for further answer and return to said order avers that he is detaining in his custody the said ALFONSO GAGLIARDI for deportation from the United States as an alien person not entitled to admission under the laws of the United States, the said ALFONSO GAGLIARDI having been heretofore arrested and detained by this respondent under a warrant of arrest issued by the Secretary of Labor of the United States, and thereafter aft having been ordered deported by said Secretary of Labor, said order to this respondent
being in the words and figures as follows, to wit:
Senator Poindexter has requested that deportation in the case hereunder be stayed to enable the attorneys to submit further evidence. The Bureau recommends that no stay be granted.

Respondent attaches hereto the original record, order, decision and exhibits, both on the hearing before the Immigration Inspector at Seattle, Washington, and the record of the submission of said hearing to the Secretary of Labor, which papers are hereby made a part and parcel of this return the same as if copies herein in full.
Wherefore, respondent prays that said writ of habeas corpus be denied.

T.W.LYNCH, being first duly sworn, upon his oath deposes and says: That he is acting commissioner of immigration, named in the foregoing return; that he has read the said return and knows the contents thereof, and that he believes the same to be true.
SUBSCRIBED and sworn to before me this 27th day of December, 1921.
Deputy Clerk, U.S. Dist. Court, Western Dist. of Washington
In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington
In the Matter of the Appliation of Alfonso Gagliardi for a Writ of Habas Corpus
Filed in the United States District Court
